title: Learning Wall Segmentation in 3D Vessel Trees using Sparse Annotations
author: Hinrich Rahlf (Institute of Computer-Assisted Cardiovascular Medicine, Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin), Markus Hüllebrand (Fraunhofer MEVIS), Sebastian Schmitter (Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt), Christoph Strecker (Department of Neurology and Neurophysiology, University of Freiburg), Andreas Harloff (Department of Neurology and Neurophysiology, University of Freiburg), Anja Hennemuth (Fraunhofer MEVIS), ...
relevance_why: The method of generating 3D pseudo-labels from 2D segmentation can inspire similar strategies in audio domain tasks, such as extracting features or segments from audio using fewer labels.
background: 3D segmentation of the carotid artery wall in magnetic resonance imaging to assess the risk of carotid artery stenosis, which is a major risk factor for strokes.
contribution: This paper introduces a method to train 3D segmentation of the carotid artery wall using sparse clinical annotations, achieving improved segmentation results.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied on dense annotations or manual creation of 3D segmentation masks, which are labor-intensive and inconsistent.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by transforming sparse 2D annotations into comprehensive 3D pseudo-labels for more efficient training of segmentation networks.

key_innovation: Combines adversarial 2D networks with centerline annotations to derive a robust 3D segmentation strategy from minimal labeled data.
real_world_impact: Enables faster and more consistent assessment of carotid artery conditions in clinical settings, which could lead to better patient outcomes.
limitations: Sparse annotations limit the evaluation in bifurcation areas and the model struggles with cross-sections showing multiple vessels.

new_terms.pseudo-labels: **Pseudo-labels** are artificial labels generated from a model's predictions on unlabelled data, used to augment the training set for supervised learning.
new_terms.adversarial network: **Adversarial network** refers to a type of neural network architecture that involves competing networks (generator and discriminator) in a game-like scenario to improve model learning.
